page.title: 11THE LAMB INN - URCHFONT
page.content: THE LAMB INN, ABOUT 300 YEARS OLD IS USED MAINLY BY LOCALS AND STUDENTS ON COURSES AT URCHFONT MANOR. IT IS OWNED BY WADWORTH BREWERY AND RUN BY TENANTS THERE IS A SKITTLE ALLEY AND DARTS ARE PLAYED REGULARLY BY BOTH A LADIES AND A GENTS TEAM. THE PUB IS USED BY MEMBERS OF THE CRICKET AND FOOTBALL CLUBS, THE CHURCH BELL RINGERS MEET THERE AND CHILDEREN REGULARLY POP IN FOR SWEETS OR SNACKS. EVERY DAY PRESCRIPTIONS ARE COLLECTED FROM THE NEAREST CHEMIST TO AWAIT COLLECTION BY THE VILLAGERS FROM THE LAMB. THE ALSO SUPPLY CALOR GAS AND THERE IS A CARAVAN CLUB PARK AT THE REAR OF THE PREMISES. TABLES AND CHAIRS ARE IN THE GARDEN FOR USE IN THE SUMMER AND THE OCCAISONAL BAR-B-QUE IS HELD. AT ALL TIMES BAR SNACKS CAN BE BOUGHT AND IN WINTER AN OPEN FIRE WARMS THE BAR.
